comments.text:
I receive regular ONE-LINE e-mails from cron, which I'd like to filter-out.

Copy-pasting the one line into the filter of type "Body is" does not lead to the messages being automatically deleted. Changing the filter to type "Body contains" works, but is not suitable to me, because, if the message contained any other text, I want to read it.

I guess, the "Body is" filter is thrown off by there being new-lines (\r\n) in the message. This makes it meaningless for most uses... Perhaps, when matching, the implementation should automatically replace all EOLs with blanks and strip the leading and tailing blanks from the body -- this would allow matching multi-line messages too.
